p: DENV RNA can be extracted from serum or plasma, as well as from whole blood (WB), blood leukocytes, fresh or paraffin-embedded tissues, mosquitoes, etc. ( Klungthong et al., 2007, Wang et al., 2000b). For storage up to 24 hours, specimens can be kept at 2°C–8°C. For longer storage, samples should be frozen at −80°C or at −196°C in liquid nitrogen. Repeated freeze–thaw cycles should be avoided for all RNA viruses. WB samples can also be spotted onto filter paper and viral RNA can then be detected for weeks or even months ( Prado et al., 2005).
